model
Class DatabaseFunctions

java.lang.Object
  model.DatabaseFunctions

public class DatabaseFunctions
extends Object

Interfaces between the program and the SQLite database. Handles all SQL queries, and maintains the integrity of the database. All methods that access the database are in this class.

Field Summary
 Connection conn
          The connection to the database.
 PreparedStatement prep
          A prepared statement for adding values to the database.

          Will be set to iterate over retrieved data from the database.

          A statement for communicating with the database.

Constructor Detail

DatabaseFunctions

public DatabaseFunctions()
                  throws ClassNotFoundException,
                         SQLException
DatabaseFunctions() connects you to the database. Every time you want to run a query in another file you have to "DatabaseFunctions db = new DatabaseFunctions();" then run things such as db.addUser();

Throws:
ClassNotFoundException
SQLException

setDefaultProfile

public void setDefaultProfile(String name)
                       throws SQLException
Changes the default profile to the profile specified by the passed-in name parameter. No effect if the profile does not exist. Sets all other "defaultProfile" fields to "no", so that only 0 or 1 profiles may be a default profile at any one time.

Parameters:
name -
Throws:
SQLException

getDefaultProfile

public ProfileTempData getDefaultProfile()
                                  throws SQLException
Gets a profile object of the default profile.

Returns:
The profile object corresponding to the default profile. Returns null if no such profile exists.
Throws:
SQLException

getProfileList

public Vector<String> getProfileList()
                              throws SQLException
Gives you a Vector of every profile in the database. Very useful for placing the profiles in a drop-down box.

Returns:
A Vector of profile names represented by Strings.

SQLException

checkFriendExists

public boolean checkFriendExists(String accountName,
                                 String friendName)
                          throws SQLException
Checks to see if a friend exists in the database for a certain account. It is OK to have the same friend convered by different accounts.

Parameters:
accountName -
friendName -
Returns:
True if the friend is found under the account, false otherwise.
Throws:
SQLException
